question: The third generation of human rights consists of which rights?
explanation:
Human rights are broadly divided into three generations of rights which are as follows -
a. First Generation Rights which consists of civil and political rights such as Freedom of Movement, Association or Assembly.
b. Second Generation Rights which consists of social and political rights such as Right to health and medical care.
c. Third Generation Rights which consists of Cultural Rights of Minorities such as full safety of sacred boks, sacred places and places of worship.
